```{r, echo = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  fig.width = 6,
  fig.asp = .6,
  out.width = "90%"
)
library(tidyverse)

options(tibble.print_min = 3)
litters_data = read_csv("./data/FAS_litters.csv")
litters_data = janitor::clean_names(litters_data)
pups_data = read_csv("./data/FAS_pups.csv")
pups_data = janitor::clean_names(pups_data)
```

The janitor package has functions to clean up your data.  Here, we only call one function with :: to clean up the names in the litters_data file
